intro: Aladenia jasminiflora, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of traditional medicinal use. Aladenia jasminiflora thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid climates.
